column1: 5~The film's title refers not only to the un-recovered bodies at ground zero
column2: but also to the state of the nation at large.~The film's title refers not only to the un-recovered bodies at ground zero
column3: but also to the state of the nation at large.Set in the hallucinatory period of time between September 11 and Halloween of 2001
column4: The Unrecovered examines the effect of terror on the average mind

column17: Speller learns that the Chicago Public School District has slated BASA for closure due to its allegedly low test scores.In collaboration with the fiercely dedicated BASA teachers and administrators - and in a stroke of the creative genius for which he was known - Steiner arms five students with video cameras.Through them
column18: they learn to tell not only their own stories of perseverance against all odds
column19: but the truth behind the test scores upon which their beloved school's closure is based."~"Black Schools Matter.The Barbara A.Sizemore Academy is an Afrocentric school in Chicago that city school officials targeted for closure in 2015.But a group of 7th and 8th grade filmmakers and their teacher were not going to stand for it.The Barbara A.Sizemore Academy (BASA) is the ""Jewel of Englewood"": an Afrocentric oasis of primary education in a community unfortunately known for its high murder rate
column20: as featured in Spike Lee's ""Chiraq"".A chance encounter at a restorative justice seminar between BASA's head of cultural affairs
column21: Jonathan Speller
column22: and filmmaker David Steiner
column23: turns out to be high-order serendipity: mere days after their meeting
column24: Speller learns that the Chicago Public School District has slated BASA for closure due to its allegedly low test scores.In collaboration with the fiercely dedicated BASA teachers and administrators - and in a stroke of the creative genius for which he was known - Steiner arms five students with video cameras.Through them
column25: they learn to tell not only their own stories of perseverance against all odds
column26: but the truth behind the test scores upon which their beloved school's closure is based.The film highlights the cultural empowerment of BASA's curriculum and devoted teachers
column27: as well as the inspiration that the students find both behind the camera lens and before it."

column1: 69~Italian millionaire Moritz Craffonara dreams about 'a bed under the stars'.~Italian millionaire Moritz Craffonara dreams about 'a bed under the stars'.He asks his friend Ross Lovegrove for help and the British designer constructs something that nobody thought was possible: a floating space capsule on top of a 2100 meter mountain in the heart of the Alps.~"Italian millionaire Moritz Craffonara dreams about 'a bed under the stars'.He asks his friend Ross Lovegrove for help and the British designer constructs something that nobody thought was possible: a floating space capsule on top of a 2100 meter mountain in the heart of the Alps.The project was named ""Alpine Capsule"" and gained media attention all over the world."~"Italian millionaire Moritz Craffonara dreams about 'a bed under the stars'.He asks his friend Ross Lovegrove for help and the British designer constructs something that nobody thought was possible: a floating space capsule on top of a 2100 meter mountain in the heart of the Alps.The project was named ""Alpine Capsule"" and gained media attention all over the world.But eventually it is something way bigger: It became Moritz' monument."~"Italian millionaire Moritz Craffonara dreams about 'a bed under the stars'.He asks his friend Ross Lovegrove for help and the British designer constructs something that nobody thought was possible: a floating space capsule on top of a 2100 meter mountain in the heart of the Alps.The project was named ""Alpine Capsule"" and gained media attention all over the world.But eventually it is something way bigger: column76: and then turns the gun on himself.As Cooper Michaels investigates his feature story for Baltimore Magazine-which he also hopes to option as a screenplay for his Hollywood comeback-Cooper not only begins to piece together the curious life of Swiss Williams
column77: but he is also forced to come to terms with his own fractured portrait
column78: as both a writer and a father."

column13: ""I Like to Move it.""
